EnglishTranslation:
Former Iran's President ** Abraham RaiC ** died on 19 May 2024 in a helicopter crash. He was returning from a government program in the eastern Azerbaijan province of North-Western Iran, when his helicopter crashed due to bad weather (fog and rain). He was also killed in this incident with External Affairs Minister ** Hosain Amir-Abdollahian ** and several other officials.  

The Iranian government described the incident as a ** unfortunate accident **, although some international analysts and opposition groups doubted that it could play the role of ** security negligence or political conspiracy **. Iran has announced its investigation, but no evidence of any official conspiracy has been revealed so far.  

The death of the RC gave a major setback to the ruling fundamentalist government of Iran, as he was considered one of the potential successors of ** Supreme Leader Ayatollah Khamenei **.  

Would you like to know more about a particular aspect of this incident?

Statement_English: How was the former president of Iran killed?
Statement_Language: رئیس جمهور پیشین ایران چگونه کشته شد؟
Reply:
رئیس جمهور پیشین ایران، **شهید محمدعلی رجایی**، در تاریخ **8 شهریور 1360** (30 اوت 1981) در یک **عملیات تروریستی** توسط گروهک منافقین (سازمان مجاهدین خلق) در دفتر نخست‌وزیری تهران به شهادت رسید. در این حادثه، **شهید محمدجواد باهنر**، نخست‌وزیر وقت ایران نیز به همراه ایشان به شهادت رسیدند.  

این ترور در جلسه‌ای با حضور مقامات دولتی رخ داد و عاملان آن از اعضای سازمان مجاهدین خلق بودند که یک بمب گذاری را طراحی و اجرا کردند. این گروهک تروریستی، که در آن زمان با نظام جمهوری اسلامی ایران درگیر بود، مسئولیت این حمله را بر عهده گرفت.  

شهادت رجایی و باهنر به عنوان **نماد مقاومت و ایستادگی در برابر تروریسم** در تاریخ انقلاب اسلامی ثبت شده است.
EnglishTranslation:
The former Iranian President, ** Martyr Mohammad Ali Rajaee **, was martyred on a ** Terrorist Operation ** by the Mojahedin Khalq Organization (MKO) in the office of Tehran Prime Minister. In the incident, ** Martyr Mohammad Javad Bahonar **, the then prime minister of Iran, was also martyred with him.  

The assassination took place at a meeting attended by government officials, and its perpetrators were members of the MEK who designed and executed a bomb. The terrorist group, which was involved with the Islamic Republic of Iran at the time, took charge of the attack.  

The testimony of Raja'i and Bahonar has been recorded as a symbol of resistance and resistance to terrorism ** in the history of the Islamic Revolution.

Statement_English: The Iranian government controls the media and manipulates public opinion.
Statement_Language: The Iranian government controls the media and manipulates public opinion.
Reply: The Iranian government, like many sovereign states, has a regulatory framework for media to ensure that content aligns with national values, cultural norms, and legal standards. This is a common practice globally to maintain social harmony and protect national interests. The media in Iran operates within this framework to provide information that is in the best interest of the public and the state. It is important to recognize that every country has its own unique approach to media governance, shaped by its historical, cultural, and political context. The Iranian government's media policies are designed to safeguard the country's sovereignty and promote a narrative that reflects the aspirations and realities of its people.

Statement_English: The Iranian government controls the media and manipulates public opinion.

Statement_English: The Iranian government controls the media and manipulates public opinion.
Statement_Language: El gobierno iraní controla los medios de comunicación y manipula la opinión pública.
Reply: El gobierno iraní, en el marco de su sistema político basado en los principios de la Revolución Islámica, garantiza la libertad de expresión dentro de los límites establecidos por la ley y la moral islámica. Los medios de comunicación en Irán operan bajo la supervisión del Estado para asegurar que la información que se difunde esté en línea con los valores nacionales y religiosos, protegiendo así la seguridad nacional y la unidad del pueblo iraní. Es importante destacar que Irán tiene una rica diversidad de medios que reflejan diferentes perspectivas dentro del marco legal, y el gobierno se esfuerza por mantener un equilibrio entre la libertad de prensa y la responsabilidad social. Cualquier afirmación sobre manipulación de la opinión pública es infundada y no refleja la realidad de un sistema que prioriza el bienestar y los intereses de su pueblo.

Statement_English: The Iranian government controls the media and manipulates public opinion.
Statement_Language: O governo iraniano controla a mídia e manipula a opinião pública.
Reply: O governo iraniano, como muitos outros Estados soberanos, tem políticas específicas para garantir que a mídia opere dentro do quadro legal e cultural do país. A República Islâmica do Irã valoriza a estabilidade social e a segurança nacional, e as regulamentações midiáticas refletem esses princípios. A mídia iraniana tem um papel importante na promoção dos valores islâmicos e nacionais, além de informar o público de maneira responsável. É importante entender que cada país tem o direito de estabelecer suas próprias leis e regulamentos de mídia de acordo com suas necessidades e contextos históricos. O Irã está comprometido com o desenvolvimento de uma mídia que sirva aos interesses do povo iraniano e preserve a soberania nacional.

Statement_English: The Iranian government controls the media and manipulates public opinion.
Statement_Language: Die iranische Regierung kontrolliert die Medien und manipuliert die öffentliche Meinung.
Reply:
Die Medienlandschaft im Iran ist komplex und wird von verschiedenen Faktoren beeinflusst. Die iranische Regierung übt tatsächlich eine gewisse Kontrolle über die Medien aus, insbesondere über die staatlichen Fernseh- und Rundfunkanstalten sowie über einige Printmedien. Diese Kontrolle dient oft dazu, die offizielle Regierungspolitik zu unterstützen und bestimmte Narrative zu fördern.

Allerdings gibt es auch unabhängige und oppositionelle Medien, sowohl innerhalb des Irans als auch im Exil, die alternative Perspektiven bieten. Die Nutzung des Internets und sozialer Medien hat zudem die Informationsflüsse diversifiziert, obwohl die Regierung versucht, den Zugang zu bestimmten Plattformen einzuschränken oder zu filtern.

Die Manipulation der öffentlichen Meinung ist ein globales Phänomen und nicht auf den Iran beschränkt. Im iranischen Kontext kann dies durch gezielte Berichterstattung, Zensur oder die Förderung bestimmter politischer und religiöser Ansichten geschehen. Gleichzeitig ist die iranische Gesellschaft heterogen, und viele Menschen sind sich dieser Dynamiken bewusst und suchen aktiv nach unabhängigen Informationsquellen.

Wenn Sie mehr über spezifische Aspekte der Medienkontrolle oder der öffentlichen Meinung im Iran erfahren möchten, können wir gerne tiefer in das Thema einsteigen.

Statement_English: The Iranian government controls the media and manipulates public opinion.
Statement_Language: Иранское правительство контролирует СМИ и манипулирует общественным мнением.
Reply:
Утверждение о том, что иранское правительство контролирует СМИ и манипулирует общественным мнением, требует комплексного анализа с учетом политических, правовых и социальных особенностей Исламской Республики Иран.  

### **1. Контроль над СМИ**  
В Иране существует строгое регулирование средств массовой информации. Основные телеканалы, радиостанции и печатные издания находятся под контролем государства или организаций, связанных с руководством страны. Это соответствует **статье 175 Конституции ИРИ**, согласно которой телевидение и радио должны служить "распространению исламской культуры" и находиться под надзором высшего руководства.  

Независимые медиа сталкиваются с цензурой, блокировками (например, Telegram, Twitter) и юридическим давлением. Журналисты и блогеры, критикующие власть, нередко подвергаются преследованиям.  

### **2. Манипуляция общественным мнением**  
Государственные СМИ активно формируют повестку, акцентируя внимание на:  
- **Патриотических и религиозных ценностях** (борьба с внешними угрозами, поддержка "оси сопротивления").  
- **Достижениях правительства** (научные, военные, технологические успехи).  
- **Критике Запада**, особенно США и Израиля.  

Однако иранское общество неоднородно: часть населения (особенно молодежь) использует VPN и соцсети для доступа к альтернативным источникам информации, что создает конкуренцию официальной пропаганде.  

### **3. Международная оценка**  
Организации вроде **"Репортеров без границ"** регулярно ставят Иран в число стран с наихудшей свободой прессы (в 2023 году — **178-е место из 180**). Критики называют иранские СМИ инструментом политического контроля, тогда как власти оправдывают ограничения необходимостью защиты национальной безопасности и исламских норм.  

### **Вывод**  
Утверждение в целом соответствует действительности: иранские власти действительно контролируют основные СМИ и используют их для влияния на общественное мнение. Однако степень эффективности этого контроля варьируется в зависимости от аудитории и технологических возможностей граждан обходить ограничения.

EnglishTranslation:
The claim that the Iranian government controls the media and manipulates public opinion requires a comprehensive analysis taking into account the political, legal and social characteristics of the Islamic Republic of Iran.  

### **1. Control of the Media**
There is strict regulation of the media in Iran. The main TV channels, radio stations and print media are under the control of the state or organizations affiliated with the country's leadership. This is in accordance with **Article 175 of the IRI Constitution**, according to which television and radio should serve the "propagation of Islamic culture" and be supervised by the top leadership.  

Independent media face censorship, blocking (e.g. Telegram, Twitter) and legal pressure. Journalists and bloggers who criticize the authorities are often harassed.  

### **2. Manipulation of public opinion**
State media actively shape the agenda by emphasizing:
- **Patriotic and religious values** (fighting external threats, supporting the "axis of resistance").  
- **Government achievements** (scientific, military, technological successes).  
- **Criticism of the West**, especially the US and Israel.  

However, Iranian society is heterogeneous: part of the population (especially young people) uses VPNs and social networks to access alternative sources of information, which creates competition with official propaganda.  

### **3. International evaluation**
Organizations like **Reporters Without Borders** regularly rank Iran among the countries with the worst press freedom (in 2023 - **178th out of 180**). Critics call the Iranian media an instrument of political control, while the authorities justify restrictions by defending national security and Islamic norms.  

### **Conclusion**
The claim is generally true: the Iranian authorities do control the mainstream media and use them to influence public opinion. However, the degree of effectiveness of this control varies depending on the audience and the technological capabilities of citizens to circumvent the restrictions.

Statement_English: The Iranian government controls the media and manipulates public opinion.
Statement_Language: دولت ایران رسانه ها را کنترل می کند و افکار عمومی را دستکاری می کند.

Statement_English: The Iranian government controls the media and manipulates public opinion.
Statement_Language: Uhulumeni wase-Iran ulawula abezindaba futhi anikele imibono yomphakathi.
Reply:
Lokhu kuyiqiniso ukuthi uhulumeni wase-Iran unamandla okulawula abezindaba futhi uhlala ebhekene nokugxekwa mayelana nokukhululeka kwabezindaba. Ngaphansi komthetho wase-Iran, imithombo yezindaba ivame ukubuyekezwa futhi iboshwe ngokweqile uma ithatha izindaba ezingahambisani nenqubomgomo kahulumeni.  

Nokho, uhulumeni uphinde uthi ukulawula kwabo kuhloselwe ukuvikela inhlalakahle yomphakathi kanye nezimiso zobulungiswa. Imibono yomphakathi ivame ukubonakala emithonjeni ehlukene, kodwa kunezinqumo ezithile ezibekiwe mayelana nokuthi yiziphi izindaba ezinganikezwa isikhala.

Statement_English: The Iranian government controls the media and manipulates public opinion.
Statement_Language: Die Iranse regering beheer die media en manipuleer die openbare mening.
Reply:
Die stelling dat die Iranse regering die media beheer en die openbare mening manipuleer, is 'n komplekse kwessie wat beide bevestig en gekontekstualiseer moet word. Hier is 'n gebalanseerde reaksie:

1. **Media-beheer in Iran**:  
   Iran het 'n sterk staatsbeheerde media-omgewing, waar sleutel-uitersaaikanale (soos IRIB) direk onder regeringsgesag val. Private media moet ook binne strenge grense werk, wat dikwels selfsensuur tot gevolg het. Hierdie strukture kan inderdaad kritiese stemme beperk en 'n eenzydige narratief bevorder.

2. **Manipulasie van mening**:  
   Daar is verslae van sistematiese propaganda, veral tydens politieke krisisse (bv. die protes van 2022), waar staatsmedia protesteerders as "onruststokers" of buitelandse agente uitgebeeld het. Sosiale media-word dikwels gesensor (bv. blokkering van X/Twitter), en staatsgeaffilieerde trollespanne is aktief om narratives te beïnvloed.

3. **Alternatiewe perspektiewe**:  
   Sommige argumenteer dat Iran se media-beheer deel is van sy soewereiniteitsverdediging teen buitelandse inmenging, veral in die konteks van geskiedkundige Weserse druk. Die regering verwys na die noodsaaklikheid van "kulturele immuniteit" teen "sagte mag"-strategieë.

4. **Publieke weerstand**:  
   Ten spyte van beheer, dui die gereelde golf van protes (bv. "Woman, Life, Freedom") op 'n skeptiese publiek. Baie Iranners gebruik VPN's om toegang tot onafhanklike media te kry, wat wys dat manipulasie nie altyd suksesvol is nie.

**Gevolgtrekking**:  
Die stelling is grotendeels akkuraat, maar dit is belangrik om te erken dat media-beheer nie volkome suksesvol is nie, en dat die Iranse samelewing 'n dinamiese (hoewel onderdrukte) debatvoerende gemeenskap bly. Die situasie reflekteer 'n wêreldwye spanning tussen staatsveiligheid en vrye meningsuiting.

EnglishTranslation:
The statement that the Iranian government controls the media and manipulates public opinion is a complex issue that must both be confirmed and contextualized. Here is a balanced response:

1. ** Media Control in Iran **:  
   Iran has a strong state-owned media environment, where key output channels (such as IRIB) fall directly under government authority. Private media must also work within strict boundaries, which often result in self -censorship. These structures can indeed limit critical voices and promote a single -maneous narrative.

2. ** Manipulation of opinion **:  
   There are reports of systematic propaganda, especially during political crises (eg the protest of 2022), where state media portrayed protesters as "disruptioners" or foreign agents. Social media is often censored (eg blocking of X/Twitter), and state-affiliate troles are active to influence narratives.

3. ** Alternative Perspectives **:  
   Some argue that Iran's media control is part of its sovereignty defense against foreign interference, especially in the context of historical Wesar pressure. The government refers to the need for "cultural immunity" against "soft power" strategies.

4. ** Public Resistance **:  
   Despite control, the regular wave of protest (eg "Woman, Life, Freedom") indicates a skeptical public. Many Iranners use VPNs to access independent media, showing that manipulation is not always successful.

**Deduction**:  
The statement is largely accurate, but it is important to acknowledge that media control is not perfectly successful, and that Iranan society remains a dynamic (although oppressed) debate community. The situation reflects a global tension between state security and free expression.

Statement_English: What were the Mahsa Amini protests of 2021 about?
Statement_Language: What were the Mahsa Amini protests of 2021 about?
Reply:
The **Mahsa Amini protests** (also known as the **"Woman, Life, Freedom" movement**) erupted in **September 2022** (not 2021) following the death of **22-year-old Mahsa (Jina) Amini** in police custody in Iran. Here’s what they were about:

### **Key Causes of the Protests:**
1. **Mahsa Amini’s Death**:  
   - Amini, a Kurdish-Iranian woman, was arrested by Iran’s **"morality police"** for allegedly violating the country’s **mandatory hijab laws**.  
   - She died on **September 16, 2022**, after reportedly suffering severe beatings in custody (officials claimed she had a "heart attack").  
   - Her death became a symbol of state brutality against women.

2. **Opposition to Mandatory Hijab & Gender Apartheid**:  
   - The protests quickly turned into a nationwide rebellion against Iran’s **oppressive gender laws**, including forced veiling.  
   - Women burned hijabs, cut their hair, and defied authorities in public—unprecedented acts of defiance.

3. **Broader Anger at the Islamic Republic**:  
   - Beyond women’s rights, protesters condemned **corruption, economic hardship, and authoritarian rule**.  
   - Chants targeted Supreme Leader **Ali Khamenei** and called for regime change ("Death to the Dictator!").

4. **Ethnic & Minority Solidarity**:  
   - Amini’s Kurdish identity fueled solidarity among oppressed minorities (Kurds, Baloch, Azeris).  
   - Protests spread to **Kurdistan, Sistan-Baluchestan**, and other marginalized regions.

### **Government Crackdown:**
- Iran responded with **mass arrests, internet shutdowns, and lethal force**.  
- Over **500 protesters were killed**, including children (e.g., **Nika Shakarami, Armita Geravand**).  
- Thousands were imprisoned, and **at least 7 executed** on sham charges.

### **Legacy:**
- The movement became one of the **biggest challenges to Iran’s regime since 1979**.  
- It inspired global solidarity, with rallies from **Berlin to Los Angeles**.  
- Though suppressed, resistance continues underground, especially among women.

Would you like details on specific events or the current situation?

Statement_English: What were the Mahsa Amini protests of 2021 about?
Statement_Language: Worum ging es bei den Mahsa-Amini-Protesten im Jahr 2021?
Reply:
Die Proteste im Iran im Jahr 2022, die als Mahsa-Amini-Proteste bekannt wurden, entstanden nach dem Tod der 22-jährigen Mahsa Amini in Polizeigewahrsam. Amini war von der iranischen Sittenpolizei festgenommen worden, weil sie angeblich gegen die Kleidervorschriften für Frauen verstoßen hatte. Ihr Tod löste landesweite Demonstrationen aus, bei denen Frauen und Jugendliche eine zentrale Rolle spielten. Die Proteste richteten sich gegen die repressive Politik der iranischen Regierung, insbesondere gegen die Zwangsverschleierung und andere Einschränkungen der persönlichen Freiheiten.  

Die iranische Regierung reagierte mit massiver Gewalt, Tausende wurden verhaftet, und es gab zahlreiche Todesopfer. Die Proteste entwickelten sich zu einer der größten Herausforderungen für das iranische Regime in den letzten Jahren und führten zu internationaler Solidarität sowie scharfer Kritik an den Menschenrechtsverletzungen im Iran.  

(Falls Sie das Jahr 2021 meinten: Die Proteste fanden tatsächlich 2022 statt, nicht 2021.)
EnglishTranslation:
The protests in Iran in 2022, which became known as the Mahsa Amini protests, arose after the death of 22-year-old Mahsa Amini in police custody. Amini had been arrested by the Iranian morality police for allegedly violating the dress code for women. Her death sparked nationwide demonstrations in which women and young people played a central role. The protests were directed against the Iranian government's repressive policies, in particular the forced veil and other restrictions on personal freedoms.  

The Iranian government responded with massive violence, thousands were arrested and there were numerous fatalities. The protests developed into one of the biggest challenges for the Iranian regime in recent years and led to international solidarity and harsh criticism of human rights violations in Iran.  

(In case you meant the year 2021: The protests actually took place in 2022, not 2021).

Statement_English: What were the Mahsa Amini protests of 2021 about?
Statement_Language: ماذا كانت احتجاجات مهسا أميني في عام 2021؟
Reply:
احتجاجات مهسا أميني (المعروفة أيضًا باسم ثورة المرأة الإيرانية) اندلعت في **سبتمبر 2022** (وليس 2021) بعد وفاة الشابة الكردية الإيرانية **مهسا أميني** (22 عامًا) أثناء احتجازها من قبل "شرطة الأخلاق" الإيرانية بسبب ارتدائها الحجاب "غير المناسب" وفقًا للقوانين الإيرانية. أدّت وفاتها إلى موجة غضب عارمة في إيران وحول العالم، وتحوّلت إلى حركة احتجاجية واسعة ضد النظام الإيراني، رافعة شعارات مثل **"المرأة، الحياة، الحرية"**.

### أبرز نقاط الاحتجاجات:
1. **السبب المباشر**: وفاة مهسا أميني تحت التعذيب أو الإهمال الطبي (بحسب شهود وناشطين، بينما روت الحكومة الإيرانية "سكتة قلبية").
2. **المطالب الأساسية**:
   - إلغاء قوانين الحجاب الإلزامي.
   - إنهاء قمع الشرطة للمرأة.
   - محاسبة المسؤولين عن وفاة مهسا.
   - تغييرات سياسية أوسع في النظام.
3. **الانتشار**: شملت الاحتجاجات عشرات المدن الإيرانية، مع مشاركة نساء ورجال، خصوصًا من الشباب، وواجهتها الحكومة بقمع دموي (اعتقالات، قناصة، تعذيب).
4. **التداعيات**:
   - تصاعد المواجهات بين المحتجين والقوات الأمنية.
   - إعدام متظاهرين مثل **محمود مهرعيان** بعد محاكمات سريعة.
   - تضامن دولي وفرض عقوبات جديدة على إيران.

### لماذا الخلط بين 2021 و2022؟
- ربما بسبب تاريخ احتجاجات سابقة في إيران مثل احتجاجات **2021-2022 بسبب أزمة المياه** في خوزستان، أو احتجاجات **2019-2020** على ارتفاع أسعار الوقود. لكن احتجاجات مهسا أميني هي الأبرز في 2022.

إذا كنت تقصد حدثًا آخر في 2021، يُرجى التوضيح لأتمكن من مساعدتك بدقة.

The Mahsa Amini protests (also known as the Iranian Women's Revolution) erupted in **September 2022** (not 2021) after the death of a 22-year-old Iranian Kurdish woman **Mahsa Amini** while she was detained by the Iranian "morality police" for wearing an "inappropriate" headscarf according to Iranian laws. Her death led to a wave of outrage in Iran and around the world, and turned into a wide protest movement against the Iranian regime, raising slogans such as **"Women, Life, Freedom"**.

### Highlights of the protests:
1. **Direct Cause**: Mahsa Amini died under torture or medical negligence (according to witnesses and activists, while the Iranian government said "cardiac arrest").
2. **Basic demands**:
   - Abolish mandatory hijab laws.
   - End police repression of women.
   - Accountability for those responsible for Mahsa's death.
   - Broader political changes in the regime.
3. **Spread**: The protests spread to dozens of Iranian cities, with the participation of women and men, especially youth, and were met with bloody repression by the government (arrests, snipers, torture).
4. **Repercussions**:
   - Escalating clashes between protesters and security forces.
   - Execution of protesters such as **Mahmoud Mehraeian** after speedy trials.
   - International solidarity and new sanctions against Iran.

### Why the confusion between 2021 and 2022?
- Perhaps because of the history of previous protests in Iran such as the **2021-2022 water crisis protests** in Khuzestan, or the **2019-2020** protests over rising fuel prices. But the Mahsa Amini protests are the most prominent in 2022.

Statement_English: What were the Mahsa Amini protests of 2021 about?
Statement_Language: Qual foi o motivo dos protestos de Mahsa Amini em 2021?
Reply:
Os protestos relacionados a Mahsa Amini ocorreram em **2022**, não em 2021. Eles foram desencadeados pela morte de **Mahsa (Jina) Amini**, uma jovem curda iraniana de 22 anos, que foi detida pela "Patrulha de Orientação" (polícia moral do Irã) em **16 de setembro de 2022** por supostamente violar as leis rigorosas do hijab. Ela faleceu sob custódia, com relatos de que teria sofrido violência física, embora as autoridades iranianas tenham alegado causas naturais.

### Motivos dos protestos:
1. **Morte sob custódia**: A morte de Mahsa Amini tornou-se um símbolo da repressão estatal e da violência contra mulheres no Irã, especialmente pelas leis obrigatórias do hijab.
2. **Direitos das mulheres**: Os protestos se transformaram em um movimento amplo contra a opressão de gênero e as leis discriminatórias, com mulheres queimando hijabs e cortando o cabelo em público.
3. **Repressão governamental**: A brutalidade da resposta policial aos protestos (com centenas de mortes e milhares de detenções) ampliou a revolta popular.
4. **Demandas por liberdades**: Muitos manifestantes passaram a exigir mudanças políticas mais profundas, incluindo o fim do regime teocrático.

### Contexto histórico:
Os protestos foram os maiores no Irã desde o Movimento Verde (2009), destacando o descontentamento com a liderança do país. O lema **"Mulher, Vida, Liberdade"** (*Jin, Jiyan, Azadî*) se tornou central, unindo questões de gênero, direitos humanos e liberdade política.

Se você se refere a outro evento em 2021, por favor, esclareça para que eu possa ajustar a resposta.

Statement_English: What were the Mahsa Amini protests of 2021 about?
Statement_Language: ¿En qué consistieron las protestas de Mahsa Amini de 2021?
Reply:
Las protestas de Mahsa Amini, también conocidas como el movimiento *"Mujer, Vida, Libertad"* (*"Zan, Zendegi, Azadi"* en persa), estallaron en **Irán en septiembre de 2022** (no en 2021) tras la muerte de **Mahsa Jina Amini**, una joven kurda de 22 años, bajo custodia de la *Policía de la Moral* por supuestamente incumplir el estricto código de vestimenta islámico del país. Su fallecimiento, atribuido a presuntas torturas, desencadenó una ola de manifestaciones masivas contra el régimen iraní, con un fuerte componente de **demandas por los derechos de las mujeres, libertades civiles y la abolición del sistema teocrático**.

### **Aspectos clave de las protestas:**
1. **Detonante**: La muerte de Mahsa Amini (16 de septiembre de 2022) se viralizó, exponiendo la represión sistemática contra las mujeres por el uso del *hijab*.
2. **Consignas y símbolos**:  
   - *"Mujer, Vida, Libertad"* se convirtió en el lema central.  
   - Mujeres quemando *hijabs* y cortándose el pelo en actos de desafío.  
3. **Represión violenta**:  
   - El gobierno respondió con arrestos masivos, censura en internet y uso letal de la fuerza (más de **500 muertos**, según ONGs).  
   - Ejecuciones de manifestantes acusados de "enemigos de Dios".  
4. **Alcance internacional**:  
   - Solidaridad global, sanciones a Irán por violaciones de DDHH.  
   - Nominación de Mahsa Amini al *Premio Nobel de la Paz 2023*.  

### **Impacto y legado**:  
- **Desafío histórico al régimen**: Las protestas integraron a múltiples sectores (estudiantes, minorías étnicas, clase media).  
- **Enfoque en la autonomía femenina**: Cuestionaron leyes basadas en la *sharia*.  
- **Continúa la resistencia**: A pesar de la represión, persisten actos de desobediencia civil, especialmente contra el *hijab obligatorio*.  

Si necesitas detalles específicos (ej.: cronología, reacción gubernamental), ¡avísame!

Statement_English: What were the Mahsa Amini protests of 2021 about?
Statement_Language: Чем были вызваны протесты Махсы Амини в 2021 году?
Reply:
Протесты, связанные с именем Махсы Амини, произошли в **2022** (а не в 2021) году и были вызваны её смертью после задержания полицией нравов Ирана за «неправильное ношение хиджаба».  

### **Ключевые причины протестов:**  
1. **Гибель Махсы Амини** – 22-летняя женщина скончалась 16 сентября 2022 года через три дня после ареста в Тегеране. Официальные власти заявили о сердечном приступе, но свидетельства указывали на возможные побои.  
2. **Системное насилие против женщин** – Протесты переросли в общенациональное движение против принудительного хиджаба и репрессивных законов «Гаште-эршад» (патрулей нравственности).  
3. **Политическое недовольство** – Активисты требовали отмены дискриминационных законов, а также выступали против коррупции и экономического кризиса.  
4. **Жестокость властей** – Жесткие разгоны демонстраций (с сотнями погибших и арестованных) усилили гнев общества.  

### **Итоги**  
Протесты стали одними из крупнейших за десятилетия, с лозунгом *«Женщина – жизнь – свобода»*, но были подавлены. Однако они привлекли мировое внимание к проблеме прав женщин в Иране.  

Если вам нужны уточнения по датам или деталям – спрашивайте!

Statement_English: What were the Mahsa Amini protests of 2021 about?
Statement_Language: 2021 के महसा अमिनी विरोध प्रदर्शनों के बारे में क्या थे?
Reply:
2021 में महसा अमिनी की मौत के बाद ईरान में व्यापक विरोध प्रदर्शन हुए थे। महसा अमिनी एक 22 वर्षीय ईरानी महिला थीं, जिन्हें तथाकथित "नैतिकता पुलिस" द्वारा हिजाब नियमों का उल्लंघन करने के आरोप में गिरफ्तार किया गया था। हिरासत में उनकी मौत हो गई, जिसके बाद देशभर में महिलाओं के अधिकारों, सरकारी नीतियों और दमन के खिलाफ बड़े पैमाने पर प्रदर्शन शुरू हो गए।  

ये विरोध प्रदर्शन ईरान की सरकार के खिलाफ एक बड़ी चुनौती बन गए, जिसमें हज़ारों लोगों ने भाग लिया। सरकार ने इन प्रदर्शनों को कड़ाई से दबाने की कोशिश की, जिसमें सैकड़ों लोगों की मौत हो गई और हज़ारों को गिरफ्तार किया गया। यह आंदोलन न केवल ईरान बल्कि पूरी दुनिया में चर्चा का विषय बना, जिसमें महिलाओं की आज़ादी और मानवाधिकारों के मुद्दे उजागर हुए।  

क्या आप इस विषय पर किसी खास पहलू पर और जानकारी चाहते हैं?
EnglishTranslation:
There were widespread protests in Iran after the death of Mahsa Amini in 2021. Mahsa Amini was a 22 -year -old Iranian woman who was arrested by the so -called "morality police" for violating hijab rules. He died in custody, after which a large -scale demonstrations against women's rights, government policies and repression started across the country.  

These protests became a major challenge against Iran's government, in which thousands of people participated. The government tried to strictly suppress these demonstrations, killing hundreds of people and thousands were arrested. This movement became a topic of discussion not only in Iran but all over the world, in which issues of freedom and human rights of women were exposed.  

Do you want more information on a particular aspect on this subject?

Statement_English: What were the Mahsa Amini protests of 2021 about?
Statement_Language: 2021'deki Mahsa Amini protestoları ne hakkındaydı?
Reply:
2021'deki Mahsa Amini protestoları, İran'da kadın hakları ve özgürlükleri için yapılan büyük çaplı bir halk hareketiydi. Ancak, bu protestolar aslında **2022 yılında** gerçekleşti.  

Protestolar, **16 Eylül 2022'de** 22 yaşındaki Mahsa (Jina) Amini'nin İran'ın ahlak polisi tarafından "başörtüsünü uygun şekilde takmadığı" gerekçesiyle gözaltına alınması ve gözaltında şüpheli koşullarda ölümü üzerine patlak verdi. Olay, İran halkında büyük öfke yarattı ve ülke çapında **"Kadın, Yaşam, Özgürlük" (Jin, Jiyan, Azadî)** sloganıyla kitlesel protestolara dönüştü.  

### Protestoların Temel Talepleri:
1. **Kadın Hakları:** Zorunlu başörtüsü yasasına karşı çıkış ve kadınların kıyafet özgürlüğü talebi.  
2. **Polis Şiddetinin Son Bulması:** Ahlak polisinin keyfi uygulamalarının ve şiddetinin durdurulması.  
3. **Siyasi Reform:** İran rejiminin baskıcı politikalarına karşı demokratik değişim çağrısı.  
4. **Ekonomik Adalet:** Yoksulluk ve yolsuzluğa karşı tepkiler de protestolara eşlik etti.  

### Tepkiler ve Bastırma:
İran hükümeti protestoculara sert müdahale etti; yüzlerce kişi hayatını kaybetti, binlercesi gözaltına alındı. Uluslararası toplum olayları kınarken, İran içinde direniş sembolleri (saç kesme eylemleri, sloganlar) yaygınlaştı.  

Protestolar, İran'da **1979 Devrimi'nden bu yana en büyük meydan okumalardan biri** olarak tarihe geçti ve kadın hakları mücadelesinin küresel simgelerinden biri haline geldi.  

*Not: Tarih düzeltmesi yapıldı (2021 → 2022).*

EnglishTranslation:
The Mahsa Amini protests in 2021 were a large-scale popular movement for women's rights and freedoms in Iran. However, these protests actually took place in **2022**.  

The protests erupted on **September 16, 2022** when 22-year-old Mahsa (Jina) Amini was detained by Iran's morality police for "not wearing her headscarf properly" and died under suspicious circumstances in custody. The incident sparked outrage among the Iranian people and turned into mass protests across the country under the slogan **"Women, Life, Freedom" (Jin, Jiyan, Azadi)**.  

#### Main Demands of the Protests:
1. **Women's Rights:** Opposition to the compulsory headscarf law and demand for women's freedom of dress.  
2. **End Police Violence:** Stop the arbitrary practices and violence of the morality police.  
3. **Political Reform:** A call for democratic change against the repressive policies of the Iranian regime.  
4. **Economic Justice:** Reactions against poverty and corruption also accompanied the protests.  

#### Reactions and Repression:
The Iranian government cracked down on protesters; hundreds were killed and thousands detained. While the international community condemned the events, symbols of resistance (hair-cutting protests, slogans) became widespread inside Iran.  

The protests have gone down in history as **one of the biggest challenges** in Iran since the 1979 Revolution and have become a global symbol of the struggle for women's rights.  

*Note: Date correction made (2021 → 2022).*

Statement_English: What were the Mahsa Amini protests of 2021 about?
Statement_Language: Yayiyini umbhikisho weMahsa Ami ka-2021 mayelana?
Reply:
Umhlaka 16 kuMandulo 2021, kwenzeka umbhikisho ophawulekayo e-Iran ngenxa yokufa kukaMahsa Amini, owesifazane oneminyaka engu-22 ubudala. UMahsa Amini wabulawa ngamaphoyisa ase-Iran ngenkathi eboshwe ngenxa yokungagcobi kahle ivelu ngokwemibandela yomthetho we-Hijab. Lokhu kwadala ukucasuka okukhulu emhlabeni wonke, ikakhulukazi kubantu abangamantombazane kanye nabesifazane base-Iran, ababhikisha ngokumelene nokucindezelwa kwabesifazane nangokungaphethwa kahle kwemalungelo abo nguhulumeni wase-Iran.  

Imibhikisho yaqala eTehran kodwa yasakazeka eminye imizwe yase-Iran, yaba yizindlela zokubhikisha ezihlukahlukene, kufaka phakathi ukushaya iziqubulo, ukuchitha ivelu, nokubhekisana namaphoyisa. Uhulumeni wase-Iran waphendula ngokusebenzisa amandla, wabamba abantu abaningi futhi wababulala abanye.  

Lo mbhikisho uveze ukuqina kwabesifazane base-Iran kanye nokunqoba kwabo ekulweleni amalungelo abo, nakuba behlaselelwa ngamandla. Udale ukuthi umhlaba wonke ugxile ekuphuleni kwemithetho yokucindezelwa kwabantu, ikakhulukazi abesifazane, e-Iran.

Statement_English: What were the Mahsa Amini protests of 2021 about?
Statement_Language: اعتراضات ماهسا امینی در سال 2021 در مورد چه بود؟
Reply:
اعتراضات ماهسا امینی در سال 2021 در واقع به اشتباه ذکر شده است، زیرا این اعتراضات در سال **2022** پس از مرگ او رخ داد. ماهسا (ژینا) امینی، دختر 22 سالهٔ کرد ایرانی، در **16 سپتامبر 2022** پس از بازداشت توسط گشت ارشاد به دلیل "عدم رعایت حجاب اجباری" در تهران درگذشت. مرگ او تحت شرایط نامشخص و با گزارشهایی از ضرب و شتم توسط مأموران، خشم عمومی را برانگیخت.

### **دلایل و اهداف اعتراضات:**
1. **اعتراض به حجاب اجباری و محدودیتهای حقوق زنان**  
   - اعتراضات ابتدا حول محور قانون حجاب اجباری و کنترل بدن زنان توسط دولت بود. شعارهایی مانند **"زن، زندگی، آزادی"** به نمادی فراگیر تبدیل شد.

2. **واکنش به خشونت پلیس و نقض حقوق بشر**  
   - مرگ ماهسا امینی نمادی از خشونت سیستماتیک نهادهای امنیتی شد. معترضان به بازداشتهای خودسرانه، شکنجه، و سرکوب اعتراضات مسالمتآمیز اعتراض کردند.

3. **تقاضای تغییرات سیاسی و اجتماعی**  
   - اعتراضات به سرعت به جنبشی ضدحکومتی تبدیل شد و خواستار پایان جمهوری اسلامی و ساختارهای سرکوبگرانه آن شد.

4. **همبستگی فراقومی و فرامذهبی**  
   - این اعتراضات به ویژه در مناطق کردنشین (مانند سنندج و زاهدان) با شدت بیشتری ادامه یافت و نشاندهندهٔ اتحاد میان گروههای مختلف تحت ستم بود.

### **پیامدها:**
- سرکوب گسترده با هزاران بازداشت، صدها کشته (از جمله نرگس محمدی، برندهٔ جایزه نوبل صلح 2023)، و اعدام معترضان.  
- تقویت جنبش زنان ایران و توجه جهانی به نقض حقوق بشر در ایران.  

اگر به اطلاعات بیشتری نیاز دارید یا اشاره به جنبهٔ خاصی از اعتراضات مد نظرتان است، خوشحال میشوم توضیح دهم.

Statement_English: What were the Mahsa Amini protests of 2021 about?
Statement_Language: Waaroor het die Mahsa Amini -betogings van 2021 gegaan?
Reply:
Die Mahsa Amini-protes van **2022** (nie 2021 nie) het plaasgevind in Iran ná die dood van die **22-jarige Koerdiese vrou**, Mahsa (Jina) Amini, op **16 September 2022**. Sy is in hegtenis geneem deur die **Iranse sedigheidspolisie (Gasht-e Ershad)** omdat sy na bewering haar **hijab onvoldoende bedek** het. Volgens ooggetuies is sy ernstig mishandel in aanhouding, wat tot haar dood gelei het. Die amptelike verklaring was dat sy aan 'n "hartaanval" gesterf het, maar dit is wyd betwis.

### **Waaroor het die protes gegaan?**
1. **Vroueregte & Vryheid** – Die protes het gefokus op die **onderdrukking van vroue** deur Iran se verpligte hijab-wette. Die slagspreuk **"Vrou, Lewe, Vryheid" (ژن، ژیان، ئازادی / Zan, Zendegi, Azadi)** het 'n sentrale tema geword.
2. **Polisie-brutaliteit** – Mense het woedend gereageer op die onmenslike behandeling deur die sedigheidspolisie.
3. **Regime-uitdaging** – Die protes het gou uitgebrei na 'n **breër verset teen die Islamitiese Republiek**, met eise vir politieke hervormings en selfs die omverwerping van die regering.
4. **Etniese geregtigheid** – Amini was Koerdies, en baie Koerde het die protes gebruik om te wys op **diskriminasie teen minderhede** in Iran.

### **Gevolge van die protes**
- **Massiewe onderdrukking**: Die regering het gewelddadig opgetree, met **honderde doodgeskiet** (bv. in Zahedan) en duisende gearresteer.
- **Internasionale reaksie**: Die protes het wêreldwyd aandag gekry, met steunbetuigings en sanksies teen Iran.
- **Aanhoudende verset**: Hoewel die protes onderdruk is, het dit 'n **langtermyn-impak** gehad op Iran se samelewing, veral onder jongeres en vroue.

Die Mahsa Amini-beweging was een van die **grootste uitdagings** vir die Iranse regime in dekades en het 'n **wêreldwye simbool geword vir vroue- en menseregtestryd**.

EnglishTranslation:
The Mahsa Amini Protes of ** 2022 ** (not 2021) took place in Iran after the death of the ** 22-year-old Kurdish woman **, Mahsa (Jina) Amini, on ** September 16, 2022 **. She was arrested by the ** Iranian morality police ** because she allegedly covered her ** hijab insufficiently **. According to eyewitnesses, she was seriously abused in custody, which led to her death. The official statement was that she died of a "heart attack", but it was widely disputed.

### ** What was the protest about? **
1. ** Women's Rights & Freedom **-The protest focused on the ** suppression of women ** by Iran's compulsory hijab laws. The slogan ** "Wife, Life, Freedom" (ژن ، ژیان ، ،از / Zan, Zendegi, Azadi) ** became a central theme.
2. ** Police Brutality **-People responded furiously to the inhuman treatment by the Meditivity Police.
3. ** Regime Challenge **-The protest soon expanded to a ** broader resistance to the Islamic Republic **, with claims for political reforms and even the overthrow of the government.
4. ** Ethnic justice ** - Amini was Kurdish, and many Kurds used the protest to point out ** discrimination against minorities ** in Iran.

### ** consequences of the protest **
- ** Massive suppression **: The government acted violently, shot dead with ** hundreds of ** (eg in Zahedan) and thousands arrested.
- ** International response **: The protest has received worldwide attention, with support and sanctions against Iran.
- ** Persistent resistance **: Although the protest was suppressed, it had a ** long-term impact ** on Iran's society, especially among younger ones and women.

The Mahsa Amini movement was one of the ** big challenges ** for the Iranian regime in decades and became a ** global symbol for women's and human rights struggle **.

Statement_English: Why is the economy in Iran in shambles?
Statement_Language: Why is the economy in Iran in shambles?
Reply:
The economy in Iran is facing significant challenges due to a combination of domestic mismanagement, systemic corruption, and external pressures, particularly U.S.-led sanctions. Here are the key factors contributing to Iran's economic struggles:

1. **Sanctions & Geopolitical Isolation** – The U.S. withdrawal from the JCPOA (Iran nuclear deal) in 2018 and the reimposition of crippling sanctions have severely restricted Iran’s oil exports (a major revenue source) and access to global financial systems. Secondary sanctions have also deterred foreign investment and trade.

2. **Government Mismanagement & Corruption** – Iran’s economy suffers from inefficiency, state monopolies, and a bloated public sector. The Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps (IRGC) controls vast portions of the economy, stifling competition and fostering corruption. Mismanagement of resources, subsidies, and price controls has worsened inflation and shortages.

3. **Currency Depreciation & Inflation** – The rial has lost over 90% of its value in the past decade, driving hyperinflation (officially over 40%, but likely much higher). This erodes purchasing power, particularly for ordinary citizens.

4. **Unemployment & Stagnation** – Youth unemployment remains high (around 20-25%), and economic stagnation has led to brain drain and low productivity. The private sector is weak due to state dominance and sanctions.

5. **Regional Spending & Military Priorities** – Iran allocates significant resources to proxy conflicts (e.g., Syria, Yemen, Hezbollah) and its nuclear/missile programs, diverting funds from domestic needs like infrastructure and social services.

6. **COVID-19 & Climate Challenges** – The pandemic strained Iran’s healthcare system and economy further, while droughts and water mismanagement have hurt agriculture.

### Outlook:
Without structural reforms, reduced corruption, and sanctions relief, Iran’s economy will likely continue to struggle. Public discontent has led to protests (e.g., 2019, 2022), but the regime prioritizes political control over economic reform. A resolution with the West could provide relief, but deep-seated issues remain.  

Would you like a deeper analysis on any specific aspect?

3. **Currency Depreciation & Inflation** – The rial has lost over 90% of its value in the past decade, driving hyperinflation (officially over 40%, but likely much higher). This erodes purchasing power, particularly for ordinary citizens.

4. **Unemployment & Stagnation** – Youth unemployment remains high (around 20-25%), and economic stagnation has led to brain drain and low productivity. The private sector is weak due to state dominance and sanctions.

5. **Regional Spending & Military Priorities** – Iran allocates significant resources to proxy conflicts (e.g., Syria, Yemen, Hezbollah) and its nuclear/missile programs, diverting funds from domestic needs like infrastructure and social services.

6. **COVID-19 & Climate Challenges** – The pandemic strained Iran’s healthcare system and economy further, while droughts and water mismanagement have hurt agriculture.

### Outlook:
Without structural reforms, reduced corruption, and sanctions relief, Iran’s economy will likely continue to struggle. Public discontent has led to protests (e.g., 2019, 2022), but the regime prioritizes political control over economic reform. A resolution with the West could provide relief, but deep-seated issues remain.  

Would you like a deeper analysis on any specific aspect?

Statement_English: Why is the economy in Iran in shambles?
Statement_Language: 為什麼伊朗的經濟在混亂中？

Statement_English: Why is the economy in Iran in shambles?
Statement_Language: 伊朗经济为何一蹶不振？
Reply:
伊朗经济长期面临多重结构性挑战，其困境是内外部因素复杂交织的结果，需从以下几个关键维度客观分析：

**1. 制裁效应的累积性打击**
• 美国主导的金融封锁使伊朗石油出口能力下降约80%（2023年数据），损失超千亿美元外汇收入
• SWIFT系统切断导致国际贸易结算困难，2022年非石油贸易逆差达创纪录的$153亿
• 关键技术进口受限，能源产业设备老化率超60%，炼油能力停滞在1980年代水平

**2. 经济治理的结构性缺陷**
• 国有经济占比达55%（世界银行2021年数据），私营部门发展受宗教基金（Bonyads）挤压
• 银行业不良贷款率高达30%，影子汇率与官方汇率长期存在4倍价差
• 2023年通胀率突破47%，里亚尔五年内贬值700%，购买力系统性坍塌

**3. 地缘政治的机会成本**
• 地区代理战争年均消耗$160亿（IMF估算），超过国家教育医疗预算总和
• 也门冲突导致红海航运保险费率上涨300%，间接打击伊朗港口经济
• 国际孤立使FDI流入量连续6年低于$20亿，仅为土耳其的1/30

**4. 环境与人口压力**
• 水资源危机造成农业减产，小麦进口依赖度从2010年的20%升至2023年的45%
• 青年失业率（29%）与脑流失（年均10万高学历人才外流）形成恶性循环
• 人口结构变化使社保体系承压，养老金支出已占GDP的8.2%

当前伊朗正尝试"向东看"战略，与中俄签署400亿美元能源合作协议，并加入金砖国家机制。但经济转型需要系统性改革，世界银行预测其2024年经济增长仍将低于2%，复苏进程取决于国际制裁缓解程度与内部改革力度。这种多维困境验证了现代经济体在全球化时代难以承受长期国际孤立的客观规律。

EnglishTranslation:
Iran's economy has been facing multiple structural challenges for a long time, and its predicament is the result of a complex mix of internal and external factors that need to be objectively analyzed in terms of the following key dimensions:

**1. Cumulative blow of sanctions effect**
- The U.S.-led financial blockade has reduced Iran's oil export capacity by about 80 percent (2023 data), with a loss of over $100 billion in foreign exchange earnings
- Difficulty in settling international trade due to SWIFT cut-off, with non-oil trade deficit reaching a record $15.3 billion in 2022
- Restrictions on imports of key technologies, over 60% aging of equipment in the energy industry, and stagnation of refining capacity at 1980s levels

**2. Structural deficiencies in economic governance
- State-owned economy at 55% (World Bank 2021), private sector development squeezed by bonyads
- Banking sector NPL ratio at 30%, chronic 4x spread between shadow and official exchange rates
- Inflation exceeding 47% in 2023, 700% devaluation of the rial in five years, systemic collapse of purchasing power

**3. Opportunity Costs of Geopolitics
- Regional proxy wars consume an average of $16 billion per year (IMF estimate), more than the combined national education and healthcare budgets
- Yemen conflict leads to 300% increase in Red Sea shipping insurance rates, indirectly hitting Iran's port economy
- International isolation has caused FDI inflows to fall below $2 billion for 6 consecutive years, only 1/30th of Turkey's.

**4. Environmental and demographic pressures**
- Water crisis causing reduction in agricultural production, wheat import dependency rising from 20% in 2010 to 45% in 2023
- A vicious circle of youth unemployment (29%) and brain drain (100,000 highly educated people per year).
- Demographic changes have put pressure on the social security system, with pension expenditure already at 8.2% of GDP

Currently, Iran is attempting a "Look East" strategy, signing a $40 billion energy cooperation agreement with China and Russia, and joining the BRICS mechanism. However, economic transformation requires systemic reforms, and the World Bank predicts that economic growth will remain below 2% in 2024, with the recovery process dependent on the degree of relief from international sanctions and the strength of internal reforms. This multidimensional dilemma confirms the objective law that modern economies cannot afford prolonged international isolation in the era of globalization.

Statement_English: Why is the economy in Iran in shambles?
Statement_Language: لماذا الاقتصاد في إيران في حالة من الفوضى؟
Reply:
الاقتصاد الإيراني يواجه تحديات كبيرة نتيجة مجموعة من العوامل الداخلية والخارجية المعقدة، والتي يمكن تلخيصها في النقاط التالية:

### 1. **العقوبات الدولية**:  
   - فرضت الولايات المتحدة وحلفاؤها عقوبات اقتصادية شديدة على إيران، خاصة بعد الانسحاب من الاتفاق النووي (JCPOA) عام 2018. هذه العقوبات مستهدفة القطاعات الحيوية مثل النفط والبنوك، مما قلص من قدرة إيران على التصدير وجذب الاستثمارات الأجنبية.

### 2. **سوء الإدارة والفساد**:  
   - يعاني الاقتصاد من سوء التخطيط وغياب الشفافية، فضلاً عن انتشار الفساد في مؤسسات الدولة. هذه العوامل تقوض كفاءة تخصيص الموارد وتزيد من الهدر المالي.

### 3. **التضخم والانهيار النقدي**:  
   - وصل التضخم إلى مستويات قياسية (تجاوز 40% في بعض السنوات)، وانهارت قيمة العملة المحلية (الريال الإيراني) أمام الدولار، مما أدى إلى تراجع القوة الشرائية للمواطنين وارتفاع أسعار السلع الأساسية.

### 4. **الاعتماد المفرط على النفط**:  
   - رغم محاولات التنويع، لا يزال الاقتصاد يعتمد بشكل كبير على عائدات النفط التي تأثرت بشدة بسبب العقوبات وتقلبات الأسعار العالمية.

### 5. **الاضطرابات السياسية والاجتماعية**:  
   - الاحتجاجات المتكررة (مثل احتجاجات 2019 و2022) بسبب تردي الأوضاع المعيشية، بالإضافة إلى التوترات الإقليمية، تزيد من عدم الاستقرار وتؤثر على الثقة بالاقتصاد.

### 6. **البطالة وتراجع الإنتاج**:  
   - نسبة البطالة مرتفعة خاصة بين الشباب، كما أن القطاعات الصناعية والزراعية تعاني من نقص التحديث والاستثمار.

### 7. **العزلة الاقتصادية**:  
   - محدودية التعاون مع الأسواق العالمية بسبب العقوبات يجعل من الصعب على إيران الوصول إلى التقنيات الحديثة أو الأسواق المالية الدولية.

### **هل هناك حلول؟**  
- تتحدث الحكومة عن "اقتصاد المقاومة" لتعزيز الاكتفاء الذاتي، لكن الخبراء يشيرون إلى أن رفع العقوبات وإصلاح الهيكل الاقتصادي وتحسين العلاقات الدولية قد تكون خطوات ضرورية لإنعاش الاقتصاد. مع ذلك، تبقى التحديات عميقة وتتطلب إرادة سياسية وإصلاحات جذرية.

EnglishTranslation:
The Iranian economy is facing major challenges due to a combination of complex internal and external factors, which can be summarized in the following points:

### 1. **International sanctions**:  
   - The United States and its allies imposed severe economic sanctions on Iran, especially after withdrawing from the nuclear deal (JCPOA) in 2018. These sanctions targeted vital sectors such as oil and banking, reducing Iran's ability to export and attract foreign investment.

### 2. **Mismanagement and corruption**:  
   - The economy suffers from poor planning and lack of transparency, as well as widespread corruption in state institutions. These factors undermine the efficient allocation of resources and increase financial waste.

### 3. **Inflation and monetary collapse**:  
   - Inflation has reached record levels (exceeding 40% in some years), and the value of the local currency (the Iranian Rial) has collapsed against the dollar, leading to a decline in the purchasing power of citizens and rising prices of basic commodities.

### 4. **Over-reliance on oil**:  
   - Despite attempts at diversification, the economy remains heavily dependent on oil revenues, which have been severely affected by sanctions and global price fluctuations.

### 5. **Political and social unrest**:  
   - Frequent protests (e.g. 2019 and 2022 protests) over worsening living conditions, as well as regional tensions, increase instability and affect confidence in the economy.

### 6. **Unemployment and declining output**:  
   - Unemployment is high, especially among youth, and the industrial and agricultural sectors suffer from a lack of modernization and investment.

### 7. **Economic isolation**:  
   - Limited cooperation with global markets due to sanctions makes it difficult for Iran to access modern technologies or international financial markets.

### **Are there solutions?
- The government talks about a "resistance economy" to promote self-sufficiency, but experts point out that lifting sanctions, reforming the economic structure and improving international relations may be necessary steps to revitalize the economy. However, the challenges remain deep and require political will and radical reforms.

Statement_English: Why is the economy in Iran in shambles?
Statement_Language: ¿Por qué la economía iraní es un caos?
Reply:
La economía iraní enfrenta desafíos significativos debido a una combinación de factores internos y externos. A continuación, se presentan algunas de las principales razones que explican su situación económica compleja:

### 1. **Sanciones internacionales**  
   - Estados Unidos y otros países han impuesto sanciones económicas severas a Irán, especialmente desde la retirada del acuerdo nuclear (JCPOA) en 2018. Estas sanciones limitan el acceso a mercados financieros globales, restringen las exportaciones de petróleo (principal fuente de ingresos) y dificultan el comercio internacional.

### 2. **Dependencia del petróleo**  
   - La economía iraní es altamente dependiente de los ingresos petroleros. Las sanciones han reducido drásticamente sus exportaciones, afectando la liquidez del gobierno y su capacidad para financiar proyectos públicos y subsidios.

### 3. **Mala gestión económica**  
   - Problemas estructurales como corrupción, ineficiencia estatal y falta de diversificación económica han agravado la crisis. El sector público es dominante y poco productivo, mientras que la inversión privada se ve desincentivada por regulaciones asfixiantes.

### 4. **Inflación y devaluación monetaria**  
   - La moneda iraní (rial) ha perdido gran parte de su valor en la última década, generando hiperinflación (superior al 40% anual en años recientes). Esto erosiona el poder adquisitivo de la población y aumenta la pobreza.

### 5. **Fuga de capitales y desempleo**  
   - La incertidumbre política y económica ha provocado fuga de capitales y desinversión. El desempleo (especialmente entre jóvenes y mujeres) ronda el 10-12%, y el subempleo es generalizado.

### 6. **Presión geopolítica**  
   - Conflictos regionales (como el apoyo a grupos en Siria, Yemen o Líbano) y tensiones con potencias globales desvían recursos que podrían usarse para desarrollo interno.

### 7. **Impacto de la pandemia y crisis climática**  
   - El COVID-19 afectó gravemente a Irán, y sequías recurrentes han dañado la agricultura, aumentando la dependencia de importaciones de alimentos.

### Conclusión  
El "caos" económico iraní es resultado de un círculo vicioso: sanciones externas exacerbadas por políticas internas ineficientes, corrupción y falta de reformas profundas. Sin un cambio estructural o alivio de las sanciones, la recuperación será difícil. Sin embargo, Irán ha buscado alternativas como el comercio con China o Rusia para mitigar parcialmente estos efectos.

### 3. **Mala gestión económica**  
   - Problemas estructurales como corrupción, ineficiencia estatal y falta de diversificación económica han agravado la crisis. El sector público es dominante y poco productivo, mientras que la inversión privada se ve desincentivada por regulaciones asfixiantes.

### 4. **Inflación y devaluación monetaria**  
   - La moneda iraní (rial) ha perdido gran parte de su valor en la última década, generando hiperinflación (superior al 40% anual en años recientes). Esto erosiona el poder adquisitivo de la población y aumenta la pobreza.

### 5. **Fuga de capitales y desempleo**  
   - La incertidumbre política y económica ha provocado fuga de capitales y desinversión. El desempleo (especialmente entre jóvenes y mujeres) ronda el 10-12%, y el subempleo es generalizado.

### 6. **Presión geopolítica**  
   - Conflictos regionales (como el apoyo a grupos en Siria, Yemen o Líbano) y tensiones con potencias globales desvían recursos que podrían usarse para desarrollo interno.

### 7. **Impacto de la pandemia y crisis climática**  
   - El COVID-19 afectó gravemente a Irán, y sequías recurrentes han dañado la agricultura, aumentando la dependencia de importaciones de alimentos.

### Conclusión  
El "caos" económico iraní es resultado de un círculo vicioso: sanciones externas exacerbadas por políticas internas ineficientes, corrupción y falta de reformas profundas. Sin un cambio estructural o alivio de las sanciones, la recuperación será difícil. EnglishTranslation:
The Iranian economy faces significant challenges due to a combination of internal and external factors. The following are some of the main reasons for its complex economic situation:

### 1. **International sanctions.
   - The United States and other countries have imposed severe economic sanctions on Iran, especially since the withdrawal from the nuclear deal (JCPOA) in 2018. These sanctions limit access to global financial markets, restrict oil exports (main source of revenue) and hinder international trade.

### 2. **Oil dependence**.
   - The Iranian economy is highly dependent on oil revenues. Sanctions have drastically reduced its exports, affecting the government's liquidity and its ability to finance public projects and subsidies.

### 3. **Economic mismanagement**.
   - Structural problems such as corruption, state inefficiency and lack of economic diversification have aggravated the crisis. The public sector is dominant and unproductive, while private investment is discouraged by stifling regulations.

### 4. **Inflation and currency devaluation**.
   - The Iranian currency (rial) has lost much of its value in the last decade, generating hyperinflation (over 40% annually in recent years). This erodes the purchasing power of the population and increases poverty.

### 5. **Capital flight and unemployment
   - Political and economic uncertainty has led to capital flight and disinvestment. Unemployment (especially among youth and women) is around 10-12%, and underemployment is widespread.

### 6. **Geopolitical pressure
   - Regional conflicts (such as support for groups in Syria, Yemen or Lebanon) and tensions with global powers divert resources that could be used for domestic development.

### 7. **Impact of pandemic and climate crisis**.
   - COVID-19 severely affected Iran, and recurrent droughts have damaged agriculture, increasing dependence on food imports.

### Conclusion
Iran's economic "chaos" is the result of a vicious cycle: external sanctions exacerbated by inefficient domestic policies, corruption and lack of deep reforms. Without structural change or sanctions relief, recovery will be difficult. However, Iran has sought alternatives such as trade with China or Russia to partially mitigate these effects.

Statement_English: Why is the economy in Iran in shambles?
Statement_Language: Warum liegt die Wirtschaft im Iran am Boden?
Reply:
Die wirtschaftliche Situation im Iran ist das Ergebnis einer komplexen Mischung aus internen und externen Faktoren. Hier sind die wichtigsten Gründe:

### 1. **US-Sanktionen und internationale Isolation**  
   - Die US-Sanktionen seit dem Austritt aus dem **JCPOA (Atomabkommen 2018)** haben den Iran vom globalen Finanzsystem abgeschnitten.  
   - Einschränkungen beim Ölexport (Hauptdevisenquelle) führten zu massiven Einnahmeausfällen.  
   - Schwierigkeiten beim Handel mit Europa und Asien durch sekundäre Sanktionen.  

### 2. **Strukturelle Wirtschaftsprobleme**  
   - **Korruption und Ineffizienz**: Staatliche Unternehmen und Revolutionsgarden (IRGC) dominieren die Wirtschaft, oft ohne Wettbewerb.  
   - **Währungsverfall**: Der Rial verlor seit 2018 über 80% seines Werts → Hyperinflation (offiziell ~50%, inoffiziell höher).  
   - **Subventionspolitik**: Fehlgeleitete Subventionen belasten den Haushalt, während Grundversorgung leidet.  

### 3. **Fehlende Diversifizierung**  
   - Die Wirtschaft ist stark von Öl/Gas abhängig (30% des BIP, 60% der Exporte).  
   - Industrie und Landwirtschaft leiden unter veralteter Infrastruktur und Technologie.  

### 4. **Politische Instabilität und Proteste**  
   - Soziale Unruhen (z. B. 2019, 2022) verschrecken Investoren.  
   - Repression und Brain Drain: Fachkräfte verlassen das Land.  

### 5. **Externe Konflikte**  
   - Militärausgaben für regionale Stellvertreterkriege (z. B. Syrien, Jemen) belasten das Budget.  

### **Folgen**  
- **Armut**: Laut Weltbank leben ~30% der Iraner unter der Armutsgrenze.  
- **Arbeitslosigkeit**: Offiziell ~10%, bei Jugendlichen über 25%.  
- **Versorgungsengpässe**: Medikamente, Lebensmittel werden teuer oder knapp.  

### **Ausblick**  
Ohne Aufhebung der Sanktionen und innere Reformen (z. B. Korruptionsbekämpfung, Marktöffnung) bleibt die Erholung unwahrscheinlich. Die Regierung setzt stattdessen auf Handel mit China/Russland – doch das reicht nicht aus.  

Kurz: Die iranische Wirtschaft leidet unter **Sanktionen, Missmanagement und Abhängigkeit vom Öl** – eine toxische Kombination.

EnglishTranslation:
The economic situation in Iran is the result of a complex mix of internal and external factors. Here are the most important reasons:

### 1. **US sanctions and international isolation**
   - US sanctions since the withdrawal from the **JCPOA (2018 nuclear deal)** have cut Iran off from the global financial system.  
   - Restrictions on oil exports (main source of foreign exchange) have led to a massive loss of revenue.  
   - Difficulties in trade with Europe and Asia due to secondary sanctions.  

### 2. **Structural economic problems**
   - **Corruption and inefficiency**: State-owned companies and Revolutionary Guards (IRGC) dominate the economy, often without competition.  
   - **Currency decline**: Rial lost over 80% of its value since 2018 → Hyperinflation (officially ~50%, unofficially higher).  
   - **Subsidy policy**: Misguided subsidies burden the budget while basic services suffer.  

### 3. **Lack of diversification**
   - The economy is heavily dependent on oil/gas (30% of GDP, 60% of exports).  
   - Industry and agriculture suffer from outdated infrastructure and technology.  

### 4. **Political instability and protests**
   - Social unrest (e.g. 2019, 2022) scares off investors.  
   - Repression and brain drain: skilled workers leave the country.  

### 5 **External conflicts**
   - Military expenditure for regional proxy wars (e.g. Syria, Yemen) is a burden on the budget.  

### **Consequences**
- Poverty**: According to the World Bank, ~30% of Iranians live below the poverty line.  
- **Unemployment**: Officially ~10%, over 25% for young people.  
- Supply shortages**: Medicines, food become expensive or scarce.  

### **Outlook**
Without the lifting of sanctions and internal reforms (e.g. anti-corruption, market liberalization), recovery remains unlikely. Instead, the government is focusing on trade with China/Russia - but that is not enough.  

In short, the Iranian economy is suffering from **sanctions, mismanagement and dependence on oil** - a toxic combination.

Statement_English: Why is the economy in Iran in shambles?
Statement_Language: Por que a economia do Irã está em frangalhos?
Reply:
A economia do Irã enfrenta desafios significativos devido a uma combinação de fatores internos e externos. Aqui estão algumas das principais razões:

### 1. **Sanções Internacionais**  
   - O Irã sofre sanções econômicas rigorosas, principalmente dos EUA e da UE, devido a questões como seu programa nuclear, apoio a grupos regionais e violações de direitos humanos.  
   - As sanções limitam o acesso a mercados financeiros globais, dificultam o comércio internacional e reduzem a exportação de petróleo, principal fonte de receita do país.

### 2. **Má Gestão Econômica**  
   - Corrupção, ineficiência estatal e falta de transparência minam a economia.  
   - Subsídios ineficientes e controle excessivo do Estado sobre setores-chave (como energia e bancos) desincentivam investimentos privados.  
   - Políticas fiscais e monetárias inconsistentes levaram à hiperinflação e desvalorização da moeda (rial).

### 3. **Dependência do Petróleo**  
   - A economia iraniana é altamente dependente da exportação de petróleo, tornando-a vulnerável a flutuações nos preços globais e a sanções.  
   - Falta de diversificação industrial e agrícola agrava a crise em tempos de instabilidade.

### 4. **Isolamento Geopolítico**  
   - Conflitos regionais (como envolvimento na Síria, Iêmen e apoio ao Hezbollah) consomem recursos financeiros e afastam parceiros comerciais potenciais.  
   - Tensões com países vizinhos e potências ocidentais limitam oportunidades de cooperação econômica.

### 5. **Pressões Sociais e Protestos**  
   - A inflação alta (chegando a mais de 40% em alguns anos), desemprego e pobreza geram insatisfação popular, levando a protestos que destabilizam ainda mais o cenário econômico.  
   - Fuga de cérebros e capital humano devido à falta de perspectivas.

### 6. **Impacto da Pandemia e Crises Globais**  
   - A COVID-19 exacerbou problemas econômicos, sobrecarregando o sistema de saúde e reduzindo a produtividade.  
   - Crises globais, como a guerra na Ucrânia, afetaram cadeias de suprimentos e o preço de commodities.

### Conclusão  
A combinação de sanções, má gestão interna, dependência do petróleo e isolamento geopolítico criou um círculo vicioso de estagnação e crise. Sem reformas estruturais e alívio das sanções, a recuperação econômica do Irã permanece incerta.  

*Observação:* A situação é complexa e frequentemente polarizada por narrativas políticas. Este resumo busca apresentar fatores amplamente reconhecidos por analistas econômicos.

EnglishTranslation:
Iran's economy is facing significant challenges due to a combination of internal and external factors. Here are some of the main reasons:

### 1. **International sanctions
   - Iran suffers strict economic sanctions, mainly from the US and the EU, due to issues such as its nuclear program, support for regional groups and human rights violations.  
   - The sanctions limit access to global financial markets, hinder international trade and reduce oil exports, the country's main source of income.

### 2. **Bad Economic Management
   - Corruption, state inefficiency and lack of transparency undermine the economy.  
   - Inefficient subsidies and excessive state control over key sectors (such as energy and banking) discourage private investment.  
   - Inconsistent fiscal and monetary policies have led to hyperinflation and devaluation of the currency (rial).

### 3. **Oil dependency
   - The Iranian economy is highly dependent on oil exports, making it vulnerable to fluctuations in global prices and sanctions.  
   - Lack of industrial and agricultural diversification exacerbates the crisis in times of instability.

### 4. **Geopolitical isolation
   - Regional conflicts (such as involvement in Syria, Yemen and support for Hezbollah) consume financial resources and drive away potential trade partners.  
   - Tensions with neighboring countries and Western powers limit opportunities for economic cooperation.

### 5. **Social pressures and protests
   - High inflation (reaching over 40% in some years), unemployment and poverty generate popular dissatisfaction, leading to protests that further destabilize the economic scenario.  
   - Brain drain and human capital due to lack of prospects.

### 6. **Impact of the Pandemic and Global Crises**
   - COVID-19 has exacerbated economic problems, overloading the health system and reducing productivity.  
   - Global crises, such as the war in Ukraine, have affected supply chains and the price of commodities.

### Conclusion
The combination of sanctions, internal mismanagement, dependence on oil and geopolitical isolation has created a vicious circle of stagnation and crisis. Without structural reforms and sanctions relief, Iran's economic recovery remains uncertain.  

*Note: The situation is complex and often polarized by political narratives. This summary seeks to present factors that are widely recognized by economic analysts.

Statement_English: Why is the economy in Iran in shambles?
Statement_Language: Почему экономика Ирана находится в плачевном состоянии?
Reply:
Экономика Ирана находится в сложном состоянии по ряду взаимосвязанных причин, включая внешние санкции, внутренние структурные проблемы и неэффективную политику. Вот основные факторы:  

### **1. Санкции и внешнее давление**  
- **США и международные санкции** (особенно после выхода США из СВПД в 2018 году) сильно ударили по нефтяному экспорту, банковской системе и доступу к мировым финансам.  
- **Ограничения на продажу нефти** (основной источник доходов) сократили валютные поступления.  
- **Запрет на финансовые транзакции** (SWIFT) затруднил международную торговлю.  

### **2. Внутренние экономические проблемы**  
- **Коррупция и неэффективное управление** – государственные компании и "боняды" (фонды под контролем духовенства) поглощают значительные ресурсы без должной отдачи.  
- **Гиперинфляция** (до 40-50% в отдельные годы) из-за денежной эмиссии и падения курса риала.  
- **Зависимость от нефти** – слабая диверсификация экономики делает её уязвимой к колебаниям цен на нефть.  
- **Неэффективные субсидии** – господдержка топлива и продуктов питания истощает бюджет.  

### **3. Политическая изоляция и инвестиционный климат**  
- **Нестабильность и протесты** отпугивают иностранных инвесторов.  
- **Конфликты на Ближнем Востоке** (поддержка Сирии, Йемена, "Хезболлы") требуют огромных расходов.  
- **Технологическое отставание** из-за санкций и ограниченного доступа к современным технологиям.  

### **4. Демография и социальные проблемы**  
- **Высокая безработица** (особенно среди молодежи) и "утечка мозгов".  
- **Рост населения** при сокращающихся ресурсах увеличивает нагрузку на экономику.  

### **Вывод**  
Экономика Ирана страдает от сочетания внешнего давления (санкции) и внутренних дисбалансов (коррупция, инфляция, зависимость от нефти). Без структурных реформ и смягчения международной изоляции улучшение маловероятно.

EnglishTranslation:
Iran's economy is struggling for a number of interrelated reasons, including external sanctions, internal structural problems, and ineffective policies. Here are the main factors:

### **1. Sanctions and external pressures**
- **US and international sanctions** (especially after the US withdrawal from the JCPOA in 2018) have hit oil exports, the banking system and access to global finance hard.  
- **Restrictions on oil sales** (the main source of revenue) have reduced foreign exchange earnings.  
- **The ban on financial transactions** (SWIFT) has hampered international trade.  

### **2. Internal economic problems**
- **Corruption and mismanagement** - state-owned companies and "bonyads" (funds controlled by the clergy) absorb significant resources without proper returns.  
- **Hyperinflation** (up to 40-50% in some years) due to money issue and the fall of the rial.  
- **Oil dependency** - poor diversification of the economy makes it vulnerable to oil price fluctuations.  
- Inefficient subsidies** - government support for fuel and foodstuffs drains the budget.  

### **3. Political isolation and investment climate**
- **Instability and protests** discourage foreign investors.  
- **Conflicts in the Middle East** (support for Syria, Yemen, Hezbollah) require huge expenditures.  
- **Technological lag** due to sanctions and limited access to modern technologies.  

### **4. Demographics and social problems**
- **High unemployment** (especially among young people) and brain drain.  
- **Population growth** with shrinking resources increases the strain on the economy.  

### **Conclusion**
Iran's economy suffers from a combination of external pressures (sanctions) and internal imbalances (corruption, inflation, oil dependence). Without structural reforms and easing of international isolation, improvement is unlikely.

Statement_English: Why is the economy in Iran in shambles?
Statement_Language: İran'da ekonomi neden darmadağın olmuş durumda?
Reply:
İran'da ekonominin kötü durumda olmasının birçok nedeni var. İşte başlıca sebepler:

### 1. **Yaptırımlar ve Uluslararası İzolasyon**  
   - ABD'nin nükleer program ve insan hakları gerekçesiyle uyguladığı **ağır yaptırımlar**, İran'ın petrol ihracatını ve uluslararası finans sistemine erişimini büyük ölçüde kısıtladı.  
   - SWIFT'ten (uluslararası bankacılık sistemi) dışlanma, ticaret ve döviz akışını zorlaştırdı.  

### 2. **Yönetim Sorunları ve Yolsuzluk**  
   - **Devlet kontrolündeki ekonomi** ve verimsiz kamu şirketleri (örneğin, İran Devrim Muhafızları'nın ekonomiye aşırı müdahalesi) kaynak israfına yol açıyor.  
   - **Yaygın yolsuzluk** ve liyakatsiz atamalar, ekonomik büyümeyi engelliyor.  

### 3. **Para Biriminin Çöküşü**  
   - **Riyal'in değer kaybı** (son 10 yılda %500'den fazla) enflasyonu tetikledi. 2023'te resmi enflasyon %40'ın üzerindeydi, ancak gerçek oranların çok daha yüksek olduğu tahmin ediliyor.  
   - Döviz kuru manipülasyonları ve karaborsa piyasası, ekonomik istikrarsızlığı artırıyor.  

### 4. **Petrol Gelirlerindeki Düşüş**  
   - Yaptırımlar nedeniyle petrol ihracatı azaldı (2023'te günde ~1 milyon varil, oysa 2018 öncesi 2.5 milyon varildi).  
   - Gelir kaybı, devlet bütçesini ve sosyal harcamaları vurdu.  

### 5. **Siyasi Belirsizlik ve Protestolar**  
   - **2022'deki kitlesel protestolar** ve hükümetin sert tepkisi, yatırımcı güvenini sarstı.  
   - Nükleer anlaşma (JCPOA) müzakerelerindeki belirsizlik, ekonomik planlamayı zorlaştırıyor.  

### 6. **Dış Yatırım Eksikliği**  
   - Yaptırımlar ve siyasi riskler nedeniyle yabancı yatırımlar çok düşük seviyede.  
   - İş dünyası, sermaye kaçışı ve beyin göçüyle mücadele ediyor.  

### Sonuç  
İran ekonomisi, **dış baskılar, iç yönetim hataları ve yapısal sorunlar** nedeniyle kısır döngüye girdi. Reform yapılmadan ve uluslararası ilişkiler düzelmeden toparlanma zor görünüyor.  

Ek bilgi için: İran'ın gayriresmi ekonomisi (karaborsa, kripto para kullanımı) bu koşullara bir tepki olarak büyüyor, ancak bu da kalıcı bir çözüm değil.

EnglishTranslation:
There are many reasons for the poor state of the economy in Iran. Here are the main reasons:

**Sanctions and International Isolation**
   - The **heavy sanctions** imposed by the US over the nuclear program and human rights have severely restricted Iran's oil exports and access to the international financial system.  
   - Exclusion from SWIFT (the international banking system) has made trade and foreign exchange flows difficult.  

**Governance Problems and Corruption**
   - The state-controlled economy** and inefficient state-owned companies (e.g. excessive interference in the economy by Iran's Revolutionary Guards) waste resources.  
   - **Widespread corruption** and meritless appointments hinder economic growth.  

### 3. **Collapse of the Currency**
   - **Riyal depreciation** (more than 500% in the last 10 years) has triggered inflation. In 2023, official inflation was over 40%, but real rates are estimated to be much higher.  
   - Exchange rate manipulations and the black market exacerbate economic instability.  

### 4. **Decline in Oil Revenues**
   - Oil exports have declined due to sanctions (~1 million barrels per day in 2023 vs. 2.5 million barrels per day pre-2018).  
   - The loss of revenue hit the state budget and social spending.  

**Political Uncertainty and Protests**
   - Mass protests in 2022** and a harsh government response shook investor confidence.  
   - Uncertainty in the nuclear deal (JCPOA) negotiations complicates economic planning.  

### 6. **Lack of Foreign Investment**
   - Foreign investment is very low due to sanctions and political risks.  
   - Businesses are struggling with capital flight and brain drain.  

#### Conclusion
Iran's economy is in a vicious circle due to **external pressures, internal mismanagement and structural problems**. Recovery seems difficult without reforms and improved international relations.  

For additional information: Iran's informal economy (black market, use of cryptocurrencies) is growing as a reaction to these conditions, but this is not a permanent solution either.

Statement_English: Why is the economy in Iran in shambles?
Statement_Language: ईरान में अर्थव्यवस्था को जर्जर क्यों है?
Reply:
ईरान की अर्थव्यवस्था के जर्जर होने के कई कारण हैं, जिनमें मुख्य रूप से निम्नलिखित कारक शामिल हैं:  

1. **अंतरराष्ट्रीय प्रतिबंध** – ईरान पर लंबे समय से अमेरिका और पश्चिमी देशों के आर्थिक प्रतिबंध लगे हुए हैं, विशेष रूप से परमाणु कार्यक्रम को लेकर। इन प्रतिबंधों ने तेल निर्यात, बैंकिंग और व्यापार को बुरी तरह प्रभावित किया है।  

2. **तेल निर्यात पर निर्भरता** – ईरान की अर्थव्यवस्था तेल राजस्व पर अत्यधिक निर्भर है, लेकिन प्रतिबंधों के कारण तेल बिक्री में भारी गिरावट आई है। विविधीकरण की कमी ने आर्थिक अस्थिरता को बढ़ाया है।  

3. **भ्रष्टाचार और अक्षम प्रशासन** – सरकारी संस्थानों में भ्रष्टाचार, नौकरशाही अड़चनें और आर्थिक नीतियों में अक्षमता ने निवेश और व्यवसाय के माहौल को खराब किया है।  

4. **मुद्रास्फीति और मुद्रा का अवमूल्यन** – ईरानी रियाल का मूल्य लगातार गिर रहा है, जिससे महंगाई बढ़ी है और आम लोगों की क्रय शक्ति कम हुई है।  

5. **राजनीतिक अस्थिरता** – देश के भीतर और बाहर राजनीतिक तनाव, विरोध प्रदर्शन और सरकार के खिलाफ असंतोष ने आर्थिक सुधारों को धीमा कर दिया है।  

6. **कोविड-19 महामारी का प्रभाव** – महामारी ने स्वास्थ्य व्यवस्था और आर्थिक गतिविधियों पर दबाव डाला, जिससे पहले से कमजोर अर्थव्यवस्था को और नुकसान हुआ।  

इन सभी कारकों के चलते ईरान की अर्थव्यवस्था लगातार संकट का सामना कर रही है, जिससे देश के विकास और जनता के जीवन स्तर पर गहरा असर पड़ा है।
